body_html:
Thanks for reaching out. This works as intended.

tf.check_numerics adds an operation to the graph that is only executed if its return value is fetched. The code snippet above ignores the return value of tf.check_numerics. The only tensor that is fetched is x, so check_numerics never runs.

The right way to use check_numerics is to assign its return value to the handle of the original tensor:
x = tf.check_numerics(x, 'nan')

The right way to use check_numerics is to assign its return value to the handle of the original tensor:
x = tf.check_numerics(x, 'nan')
body:
Thanks for reaching out. This works as intended.

tf.check_numerics adds an operation to the graph that is only executed if its return value is fetched. The code snippet above ignores the return value of tf.check_numerics. The only tensor that is fetched is x, so check_numerics never runs.

The right way to use check_numerics is to assign its return value to the handle of the original tensor:
    x = tf.check_numerics(x, 'nan')
